title: Simon Sight: A Computer Vision Game
excerpt: Explore the Simon Sight project, a classic Simon game implemented with computer vision, using webcams for buttons and lights based on dark/light pixel ratios.
author: Codem
content: Introducing Simon Sight: The Vision-Controlled Game--I decided to dive into OpenCV to explore the concept of ratios of dark to light pixels. This led me to create a program that detects total camera coverage, which I then used to develop "camera buttons."--Alongside a program I made to initiate and stop cameras, I essentially gained control over both the LED on the camera and the coverage control.--### Implementation--Using these building blocks, I put together a quick Simon game program, which I've named Simon Sight. It uses sounds from a speaker and webcams act as both the buttons and the lights for the game.--### Try It Out!--You can check out the project on the portfolio if you want to try it out. The link to the GitHub repo is open for modification and use!I'm excited to see what you build with it!
